resources.string: How do you quit apps?\nPressing Back always means that you have finished your work and wanted to quit.\nPressing Home will start the launcher and kick this app into background.

We love this design of Android, but some apps do not. They keep them in background and drain your battery, some even push useless notifications to draw your attention.

And Brevent is going to protect your phone from these apps.
Swiping away from Recent Screen or pressing Back and they will be force-stopped.
Pressing Home and they will be kept in the background to complete their tasks. Once the time period you set is out, they will be force-stopped.

For background apps, Brevent shows the idle time dynamically.
What do you need to do? \nJust a simple command with your PC.

Some similar apps require ROOT access or modifying your unlocked device. Debugging mode doesn\'t require ROOT access nor unlocking, so it\'s much safer to use. \n\nThere is an experimental ROOT mode, allowing you to skip turning on debugging mode. You can press Back 7 times on \"Please start Brevent service\" page to \"Run as Root\", or press \"Version\" 7 times in \"Settings\" to show experimental ROOT mode. ROOT mode is unsafe and unnecessary, we do not offer support for those who prefer ROOT mode.

We need debugging mode to launch our Brevent without rooting your device. However, debugging mode is not safe enough, we strongly recommend you turn it off after Brevent service is started successfully.
Brevent uses plenty of Android\'s hidden APIs. Some third-party ROMs may modify these APIs, so there would be some issues when using.
Enjoy Brevent, and feel free to feedback.

The default Brevent method is "App Standby"(since Android 6.0). If you find some apps still running, please use Brevent or other tools to check its status.

And to increase battery performance, Brevent server delay the processes by 3 to 60 seconds according to the event level.

When you swipe apps away from recent screen, Android will kill the processes and Brevent would force-stop them ASAP.

ADB (Android Debug Bridge) is a command-line tool that lets you communicate with an Android device. It\'s part of platform-tools, you can download it from here: https://developer.android.com/studio/releases/platform-tools.html (Long press, then select and copy).

1. uncompress platform-tools-latest-<platform>.zip

2. navigate to platform-tools directory

3. (for Windows) Hold Shift key, then right-click, choose "Open command window here", you can run ".\adb" now

3. (for Mac OS X) Navigate "Finder", "Applications", "Utilities", open "Terminal", then drag "adb" into the "Terminal" (please remove duplicate "adb" when paste the command line)

1. Turn on "Developer options", enable "USB debugging" %1$s

2. Connect to PC via USB %2$s, or read "Guide - Permissions" to run as ROOT (experimental)

3. Execute in PC's command line "adb devices", make sure PC can find device (Reader "Guide - ADB")

4. Execute in PC's command line "%3$s"
Brevent service started successfully. Please click app icons to choose them and brevent them
Retrieving processes status, just a moment. . .
Waiting events, please open then close notification to make events. . .
Feel free to feedback.\n\nIf you have a GitHub account, please create an issue; you can view opened issues too.%s
Update Brevent list when apps installed or uninstalled

Standby when you exit apps (by pressing \"Back\"), or background apps timed out; force-stop when reach standby time out or clear them from Recent Tasks list\n\nAlways force-stop awaken apps which have no activity
Standby when you exit apps (by pressing \"Back\"), or background apps timed out\n\nAlways force-stop awaken apps which have no activity
Force-Stop when you exit apps (by pressing \"Back\"), or background apps timed out, or clear apps from Recent Task list\n\nBrevent always force-stop awaken apps which have no activity
Background apps will be brevented after %s\n\nBrevent shows inactive time for background apps dynamically
Force-stop when apps have standby for %1$s
Only turn off if device freeze when unlocking or viewing notification
Brevent immediately and force-stop non-service processes.\n\nBe careful
All apps have the same signature with framework\n\nBe careful when breventing framework apps
Including system and framework apps which cannot be open\n\nBe careful when breventing system and framework apps which cannot be open
When checked, connected VPN won\'t be standby nor force-stopped\n\nRequires donate total 2 USD for Play version
Some apps move background instead of exit when pressing Back\n\nRequires donate total 2 USD for Play version
When checked, allow ROOT to start Brevent service without \"USB Debugging\"\n\nRequires donate total 3 USD for Play version
Start Brevent server when receives \"boot completed\"\n\nDepends on \"Allow run as ROOT\"
